episodeTitle: A Massive Confused Fight! The Straw Hats vs. The New Fish-Man Pirates!
episodeTitleJapanese: 大乱戦！一味VS新魚人海賊団！
episodeTitleRomanized: Dai-ransen! Ichimi tai Shin Gyojin Kaizokudan!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates engage in fierce battles against the New Fish-Man Pirates officers. Meanwhile, Luffy and the three Neptune princes desperately try to protect Shirahoshi from Hody Jones as Vander Decken loses consciousness, causing the massive ship Noah to begin falling toward Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Nami Debuts Black Ball: Raiun Rod
events.description: Nami uses her new Sorcery Clima-Tact technique, Black Ball: Raiun Rod, creating a long chain of dark clouds that electrocute enemies within range. The New Fish-Man Pirates wonder if she is a witch, but she reveals it's carefully calculated chemistry.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's post-timeskip abilities and her improved mastery of weather manipulation through science.

quotes.text: You can call me Ms. Magician, but in reality my attack is carefully calculated chemistry.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami responds to the New Fish-Man Pirates calling her a witch

events.title: Brook Protects Nami from Ikaros Much
events.description: When invisible Zeo grabs Nami's ankles and Ikaros Much tries to stab her with a spear, Brook appears in front of her and takes both attacks at once - Ikaros' spear and Nami's slap after he asks to see her panties.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's chivalrous protection of the crew's women and his skeletal body's unique defensive capabilities.

quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's signature joke even while protecting Nami

events.title: Chopper Uses Horn Cannon Elf Against Dosun
events.description: Chopper smells Dosun approaching and tells Usopp to duck, then hits Dosun in the chin with his Horn Cannon Elf technique.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's enhanced combat abilities and heightened senses after the two-year timeskip.

events.title: New Fish-Man Pirates Officers Consume Energy Steroids
events.description: Ikaros Much, Daruma, Zeo, and Dosun all take Energy Steroids before facing their opponents. The anime explicitly shows all four officers consuming the legendary pills that boost their strength by drawing on their innate power, though it accelerates their aging.
events.significance: Raises the stakes of the battles and demonstrates the desperation of the New Fish-Man Pirates. Also foreshadows the dangerous side effects of the Energy Steroids.

events.title: Usopp Deploys Pop Green Explosives
events.description: Usopp uses his new Pop Green ammunition against the New Fish-Man Pirates, showcasing his improved arsenal from his training on the Boin Archipelago.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's upgraded combat capabilities after the timeskip.

events.title: Hody Jones Pursues Shirahoshi
events.description: Hody Jones relentlessly chases Shirahoshi through the water, intent on killing the Mermaid Princess. Luffy, struggling in the seawater, works with the three Neptune princes (Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, and Manboshi) to protect her.
events.significance: Central conflict of the episode - protecting Shirahoshi from Hody's murderous intent while dealing with the falling Noah.

events.title: Ryuboshi and Manboshi Redirect Shirahoshi
events.description: Ryuboshi realizes what will happen if Vander Decken dies. He tells Shirahoshi to swim to one side to avoid danger. Hody cuts Ryuboshi with his Kirisame sword technique immediately after.
events.significance: Critical moment where the Neptune brothers realize the dire situation with Noah and try to protect their sister.

events.title: Luffy Realizes Noah's Danger
events.description: Luffy realizes what will happen if Noah falls on Fish-Man Island and tells Fukaboshi to take him to Shirahoshi. Hody tries to stop them, but Manboshi shouts that Shirahoshi broke off to the right.
events.significance: Luffy understands the gravity of the situation and takes action to prevent the destruction of Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Vander Decken Falls Unconscious
events.description: Inside Noah, Vander Decken IX prepares to throw an axe to kill Hody Jones, but the weight of the axe causes him to fall down and hit his head, knocking him unconscious. This is different from the manga where he simply slipped.
events.significance: Critical turning point - Decken losing consciousness means his Devil Fruit powers begin to fail, causing Noah to fall toward Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Noah Begins Falling Toward Fish-Man Island
events.description: With Vander Decken unconscious, his Mark-Mark Fruit powers that kept Noah airborne and directed at Shirahoshi begin to fail. The massive ship starts falling directly down toward Fish-Man Island, threatening to destroy the entire kingdom and kill all its inhabitants.
events.significance: The main crisis of the arc escalates - the entire island faces destruction. This fulfills Madam Shyarly's prophecy about Luffy destroying Fish-Man Island and sets up the climactic battle.

events.title: Ikaros Much's Multiple Spear Attacks on Brook
events.description: Unlike in the manga, Ikaros Much pierces Brook multiple times with his spears before realizing that his attacks have no effect on Brook's skeletal body.
events.significance: Anime-original extension showing the futility of piercing attacks against Brook's unique physiology.

events.title: Ikaros Much Gets Shocked by Electrocuted Underling
events.description: In the anime version, one of Ikaros Much's electrocuted underlings comes in contact with him, shocking him as well. In the manga, he only bent his back when close to the electrocuted underlings.
events.significance: Minor anime-original addition showing Ikaros being affected by his own allies' misfortune.

quotes.text: You can call me Ms. Magician, but in reality my attack is carefully calculated chemistry.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami explains her Black Ball: Raiun Rod technique

quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's signature request while protecting Nami from attack

themes.description: The episode emphasizes protecting those who cannot protect themselves, with Luffy and the Neptune brothers risking their lives to save Shirahoshi, and the Straw Hats fighting to protect Fish-Man Island's citizens.
themes.symbolism: The falling Noah represents the weight of past promises and responsibilities that threaten to crush the present.
culturalReferences: Noah's Ark - Biblical reference to salvation and promise

themes.description: The Straw Hat Pirates work together, each member handling different opponents. Luffy collaborates with the Neptune princes despite their different backgrounds.
themes.symbolism: Unity between different species (humans and fish-men/merfolk) working toward a common goal.

themes.description: The Energy Steroids provide temporary strength but at the cost of accelerated aging. Vander Decken's Devil Fruit power becomes a threat when he loses control.
themes.symbolism: The dangerous allure of shortcuts to power and the importance of maintaining control.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her improved weather manipulation abilities post-timeskip, confidently taking on multiple opponents with her Sorcery Clima-Tact.
keyActions: Uses Black Ball: Raiun Rod to electrocute multiple enemies
Explains her techniques as science rather than magic
quotes: You can call me Ms. Magician, but in reality my attack is carefully calculated chemistry.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being weakened by seawater, Luffy shows determination to protect Shirahoshi and Fish-Man Island, working with the Neptune princes.
keyActions: Struggles through seawater to reach Shirahoshi
Realizes the danger of Noah falling
Asks Fukaboshi for help reaching Shirahoshi

characterSpotlights.development: Brook demonstrates his chivalry and unique skeletal advantages in combat while maintaining his comedic personality.
keyActions: Protects Nami from Ikaros Much's spear attack
Takes multiple piercing attacks without injury

characterSpotlights.development: Vander Decken's obsession and physical limitations catch up to him, leading to unconsciousness and the loss of control over his Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Attempts to throw an axe at Hody Jones
Loses control of his Mark-Mark Fruit powers

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime explicitly shows Ikaros, Daruma, Zeo, and Dosun all taking Energy Steroids right before facing their opponents. In the manga, only Daruma was explicitly shown taking the Energy Steroids.
In the anime, Ikaros Much pierces Brook multiple times before realizing his spears have no effect. This extended sequence wasn't in the manga.
In the manga, Ikaros Much only bends his back when close to the electrocuted underlings. In the anime, one of them comes in contact with him, shocking him as well.

In the anime, Vander Decken is preparing to throw an axe at Hody, but the weight of the axe causes him to fall down and hit his head. In the manga, Decken simply slipped and hit his head before getting back on his feet.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 640 of the manga, pages 2-19.
Episode 561 is part of Season 15, also known as Piece 11, which covers the Fish-Man Island Arc.
The episode originally aired on August 26, 2012 in Japan, but was simulcast a day earlier on August 25, 2012 for international audiences.
The opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was used for episodes 517-590, making it one of the longer-running opening themes in the series.
This episode did not have an ending theme, as ending themes were discontinued from episode 279 until they were reinstated with episode 1071, a gap of nearly 17 years.
The Energy Steroids shown in this episode are based on real-life performance-enhancing drugs, with similar consequences of temporary power gains followed by severe long-term health effects.
